intro: Raphionacme volubilis, commonly known as the climbing raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a perennial vine characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Raphionacme volubilis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
